newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU committee will not discuss Irish punt--source.
newsitem.headline: EU committee will not discuss Irish punt--source.

text.p: The European Union's monetary committee will not discuss recent developments in the Irish punt when it meets on Friday, a senior EU official said.
"There is no intention whatsoever to talk about the Irish punt," the official said, adding that the recent strength of the currency had "no economic justification."
Currency markets have been rife with speculation of a possible revaluation of the punt within Europe's Exchange Rate Mechanism.
The official, however, cautioned that such a move could potentially unleash additional problems within the ERM.
The meeting of national treasury and central bank officials had been planned in advance and due to conflicting schedules could only be set for this Friday.
The group is expected to discuss further preparations for economic and monetary union.
